9 Experiential Marketing Trends 2030 Businesses Must Know
Customer experience is no l
onger just about providing good service. It has become the cornerstone of marketing strategy across all sectors—whether in SMEs, retail businesses, or government organizations. But have you ever wondered how experiential marketing trends in 2030 will evolve? With cutting-edge technology as a key driver and consumers expecting more complex, higher standards from brands, the landscape is set for a dramatic shift.
9 Experiential Marketing Trends 2030: What Consumers Will Expect in the Future ?
1. Merging the Physical and Digital Worlds (Merged Reality)
Merged Reality is set to eliminate the divide between “offline” and “online” experiences. Using Mixed Reality (MR) technology, consumers will engage with brands through a hybrid of physical and digital experiences. For example, retail stores might allow customers to try on products from home using MR glasses, or government service centers could offer simulations to teach citizens how to navigate bureaucratic processes. This trend creates new touchpoints that foster a deeper connection with brands—regardless of location.
2. Immersive, Participatory Experiences
Experiential marketing in 2030 will move beyond presentation and into full-on participation. Consumers won’t settle for passive advertising—they want to be “players” in the brand experience. Immersive technologies like 360° environments, multi-sensory interaction, and spatial audio will be key features in product demonstrations, events, and even government training. These experiences go beyond visuals to build meaningful, emotional connections with participants.
3. AI and Automation for Personalized Communication
AI and machine learning will become core brand ambassadors. Beyond answering questions or recommending products, these technologies will interpret customer needs, communicate naturally, and deliver hyper-relevant experiences. Think human-like chatbots, real-time virtual hosts at events, or auto-generated personalized content based on user context. Strategically implemented, AI will allow brands to offer care and precision that once seemed impossible.
4. Hyper-Personalization Becomes the New Standard
Hyper-personalization isn’t just about addressing customers by name in emails. It means deeply understanding each individual’s life stage, emotions, and needs at every touchpoint. Brands will use data from multiple sources—click behavior, in-store movement, even health data—to create personalized experiences. For instance, sending a fitness promotion to someone who just joined a gym, or dynamically adjusting app UX to match a user’s style.
5. Digital Trust as the Foundation of Experience
By 2030, trust will no longer be optional—it will be expected. Consumers will choose brands that prioritize transparency and data protection. For experiential marketing 2030, this means building on digital ethics: clear consent policies, data transparency, and secure systems. Brands that fail to deliver on this front, no matter how compelling their experiences, risk swift backlash from consumers and society.
6. Loyalty Programs as Lifestyle Ecosystems
Loyalty programs will evolve far beyond points and rewards. They will become ecosystems supporting long-term relationships, integrating with health services, travel, or social initiatives. Customers will enjoy benefits that align with their lifestyle—like converting online shopping points into online course discounts or charitable donations. In experiential marketing trends 2030, brand loyalty will be defined by how well brands support their customers' personal goals.
7. Digital-First Experiences as the Core Strategy
Future products and services will be designed with digital experience at the core—not as a supplementary channel. Picture branchless banks offering fully integrated mobile apps or shopping malls with AR platforms enabling customers to browse from home. A digital-first mindset enables brands to scale efficiently, reduce costs, increase flexibility, and meet the needs of digitally native consumers.
8. Omnichannel Will Become the Norm
Consumers will expect seamless experiences across all platforms and physical spaces. They want brands to “remember” and “understand” every interaction—be it a website chat, an in-store purchase, or an event registration. A unified omnichannel approach ensures consistent messaging and functionality, increasing satisfaction and driving repeat purchases.
9. Sustainability as a Core Principle in Tech Design
Technology that performs well must also respect the planet. Experiential marketing in 2030 will spotlight sustainable practices—monitoring the carbon footprint of digital campaigns, efficient use of cloud systems, energy-saving hardware choices, and low-waste events. Brands that demonstrate real environmental commitment and embed ESG principles into their experience design will earn greater consumer loyalty.
Experiential marketing 2030 goes far beyond using digital tools—it’s about creating a “new world” where brands and consumers connect deeply through immersive technology, AI, trust, and sustainability. Businesses that want to thrive must begin laying this foundation today to keep pace with fast-changing consumer expectations.

AI Board: The Team Gartner Says Organizations Should Have
It is undeniable that in today's world,
technology
is playing a significant role, prompting organizations to adapt and prepare for major changes. This includes training employees to effectively utilize AI in their work and incorporating AI into various operational processes to enhance efficiency and speed.
Recently, Gartner, a leading global IT research and advisory company, released a study showing that over 55% of organizations worldwide have established a dedicated committee to oversee AI-related tasks, commonly known as an
"AI Board."
Additionally, 54% of organizations have appointed an AI Leader, a role responsible for managing and coordinating AI efforts. According to Frances Karamouzis, Vice President of Research at Gartner, even though there are differing opinions globally regarding the necessity of establishing an AI Board within organizations, it is ultimately acknowledged that having an AI Board is essential for modern organizations. This team drives the potential of AI utilization in a proper and suitable manner.
Who is the AI Board?
The AI Board is a team of personnel consisting of experts from various fields. Their main responsibilities include setting the direction, planning strategies, and overseeing the effective implementation of AI within the organization.
Roles and Importance of the AI Board
Defining AI Vision and Strategy
The AI Board plays a crucial role in shaping the long-term direction of AI utilization within the organization. This involves setting a clear vision of how AI will be used to create value and competitive advantage. The board must develop strategies aligned with the overall business goals, considering both opportunities and challenges that may arise. Additionally, the team should explore new avenues for applying AI to improve workflows, develop products and services, or create new business models.
Prioritizing AI Projects
Given limited resources, the AI Board is responsible for evaluating and prioritizing various AI projects based on factors such as financial returns, alignment with strategy, technical feasibility, and impact on the organization. The team must decide which projects to invest in first and allocate budget, personnel, and other resources accordingly to ensure the organization maximizes the benefits from AI investments.
Overseeing Ethics and Responsibility
The AI Board must establish clear policies and guidelines for the responsible development and use of AI. This includes addressing issues such as transparency, fairness, non-discrimination, and respect for human rights. They should also implement mechanisms for reviewing and auditing AI system decisions to ensure compliance with ethical standards and relevant laws. Furthermore, the board should promote awareness across all levels of the organization about the importance of ethics in AI usage.
Managing AI-Related Risks
The adoption of AI in organizations may introduce various risks, such as data security, privacy concerns, and impacts on the workforce. The AI Board plays a critical role in identifying, assessing, and managing these risks by developing comprehensive risk management plans, implementing preventive measures, and establishing monitoring systems to detect and respond to potential risks promptly. The board should also consider long-term impacts, such as changes in the labor market, and plan accordingly.
Cultivating an AI-Ready Organizational Culture
Continuous learning and development of AI skills should be encouraged, along with openness to change and innovation. The AI Board needs to communicate the vision and benefits of AI clearly to employees at all levels, encourage experimentation and learning from mistakes, and foster an environment where employees feel safe to voice their opinions and contribute to AI development within the organization.
Coordinating Between AI-Related Departments
The AI Board must facilitate collaboration among various departments involved with AI, such as IT, R&D, operations, and HR. This involves creating mechanisms for sharing information, knowledge, and resources to ensure effective teamwork. The Board should also help resolve conflicts that may arise and promote the integration of AI into organizational processes.
Monitoring and Evaluating AI Implementation, and Continuously Improving Strategy
The AI Board is responsible for establishing appropriate metrics to evaluate performance, financial returns, and organizational impact across different dimensions. They must analyze this data to assess the success of AI campaigns, identify problems and obstacles, and find opportunities for improvement. This information should be used to continuously refine AI strategies and operations, ensuring that the organization can leverage AI effectively and sustainably.
Composition of the AI Board
Chief AI Officer (CAIO):
The leader responsible for the organization's AI strategy and operations. The CAIO sets the vision and direction for AI implementation.
Data Scientist:
An expert in data analysis and interpretation, responsible for designing and developing AI models.
AI Engineer:
Focuses on developing and deploying AI systems, as well as maintaining AI infrastructure.
Business Analyst:
Connects business needs with AI solutions, analyzing the impact and opportunities AI presents to the business.
Legal Counsel:
A legal advisor who handles legal matters and ensures compliance with regulations related to AI.
Ethics Officer:
Responsible for overseeing the ethical use of AI and ensuring responsible AI practices.
Human Resources Representative:
Represents HR, focusing on the impact of AI on employees and facilitating skill development.
IT Security Specialist:
A cybersecurity expert responsible for ensuring the security of AI systems and protecting data.
Domain Expert:
A specialist with expertise in the specific industry or field relevant to AI applications.
Project Manager:
Oversees the planning, execution, and monitoring of various AI-driven campaigns and projects.
Having an AI Board not only helps organizations fully leverage the benefits of AI but also demonstrates their commitment to being leaders in innovation and truly adapting to the digital age. Ultimately, organizations that can effectively integrate AI into their business strategies will gain a competitive advantage and create lasting value for their customers, employees, and society.

AI Search Marketing: Boosting Brand Visibility in the AI Era
From the familiar Google search everyone knows, we now have AI-driven search engines that can synthesize information and provide answers tailored to the user’s needs instantly. Whether it’s ChatGPT, Bing Copilot, or Google SGE (Search Generative Experience), these tools present answers that go beyond just listing results from websites. They offer responses that take into account the user's intent and the reliability of the information.
In an era where AI plays a central role in information retrieval, adapting to AI Search or
"AI Search Marketing"
has become increasingly important. This process ensures that your brand "appears" in the answers that AI presents, enabling you to directly reach customers and increase business growth effectively.
What is AI Search Marketing?
AI Search Marketing is a marketing strategy focused on ensuring your brand "appears" or is featured in the responses AI generates when answering user questions. Unlike traditional search engines that pull information solely from websites or databases, AI can now also retrieve data from various other sources such as forums, social media, and open-source databases. This diversity makes AI responses more comprehensive and varied.
Simply put, AI Search Marketing isn’t just about providing information on your website; it’s about ensuring that your data is selected by AI to be used as an answer—one that aligns with the user’s intent and presents a suitable solution.
How Does AI Search Marketing Differ from SEO?
Both SEO (Search Engine Optimization) and AI Search Marketing aim to appear in user search results, but they have clearly different approaches and processes:
SEO to Rank on Google:
SEO focuses on optimizing a website so that it ranks on traditional search engines like Google. This involves improving content quality and using relevant keywords.
AI Search Marketing to Be Selected by AI:
In contrast, AI Search Marketing focuses on getting your brand’s information selected by AI to be used in its responses. AI pulls from a variety of data sources, such as website content, forum discussions, or social media conversations.
Behind the Scenes of AI Search
AI Search Marketing relies on complex processes to synthesize data from multiple sources in order to provide the most accurate and appropriate answers to users. Key steps in this process include:
Using Data from Multiple Sources:
AI pulls from websites, forums, social media, and open-source databases to create the most relevant answer.
User Intent Analysis:
AI analyzes the intent behind the user’s query—whether they are looking for general information, recommendations, or step-by-step guidance (How-to).
Answer Synthesis:
After gathering information, AI selects and synthesizes the most relevant and accurate response to meet the user’s needs.
How to Do AI Search Marketing and Ensure Your Brand Appears in AI Responses
1. Create In-Depth and Accurate Content
Creating detailed content that thoroughly answers user questions is a core strategy in AI Search Marketing. AI pulls data from multiple sources to process and provide the most precise answers. High-quality content should address all aspects of a question and make it easier for AI to select your data as the answer.
For example, if a user asks about choosing an energy-efficient air conditioner, the content should cover factors like capacity, energy usage, installation, maintenance, and performance.
2. Focus on Q&A, How-to, or Pain Point Content
Content like Q&A or How-to articles is favored by AI, as it directly answers the user's questions. Addressing pain points (problems or needs) is equally important, as it provides practical solutions that users are looking for, especially when they need help solving a specific issue, such as caring for skin dried out by air conditioning.
3. Use Structured Data / Schema Markup
Structured Data or Schema Markup organizes information in a way that AI can easily understand. Adding Schema Markup to your website helps AI quickly retrieve and use your data in its responses. For example, if your website contains restaurant information, Schema Markup allows AI to recognize this and use it to answer queries about restaurant locations, menus, and more.
4. Boost Brand Credibility (E-E-A-T)
A key factor in getting your brand featured in AI search results is building credibility through E-E-A-T: Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, and Trust. AI prioritizes content from brands that demonstrate high E-E-A-T:
Experience:
The brand's experience in providing services or products.
Expertise:
The brand’s proficiency in its industry.
Authoritativeness:
The brand’s reputation and industry leadership.
Trust:
The trustworthiness from users or reputable sources.
A high E-E-A-T score signals to AI that your content is valuable and reliable, increasing the likelihood of it being featured in AI-generated answers.
5. Distribute Information Across Multiple Channels (Omni-channel Footprint)
Distributing brand information across various channels increases the likelihood that AI will use your content in its answers. By sharing data through your website, social media, and services like Google My Business, you create a broader presence that AI can pull from, improving the accuracy and relevance of its responses.
6. Regularly Update Content
AI tends to favor fresh, up-to-date content. Regularly updating your website ensures your brand's content remains relevant and timely. This could include adding industry updates, addressing frequently asked questions, or correcting errors in older content.
Case Study: Brands Successfully Using AI Search Marketing
In recent years, several brands have succeeded by leveraging AI Search Marketing, particularly within digital marketing and SEO sectors. These brands have attracted attention from AI-driven tools like ChatGPT and other AI platforms.
1. HubSpot
HubSpot provides an all-in-one inbound marketing platform that includes tools for CRM, content creation, and digital campaign management. By creating content that answers user questions on various topics like SEO, digital content creation, and online sales techniques, HubSpot has become a go-to resource for AI when responding to queries about marketing.
HubSpot’s use of Structured Data makes it easy for AI to access and present their content. Regular updates ensure the information remains relevant to current trends and user needs.
2. Moz
Moz, a well-known brand in the SEO industry, uses AI Search Marketing effectively by providing in-depth content related to SEO tools and strategies. Their content often comes in the form of Q&A, How-to guides, and expert advice, making it easy for AI to feature Moz’s resources in search results about SEO.
The benefits of AI Search Marketing are vast. It enhances your brand's visibility in AI-powered search engines, directly targets users with high-quality, relevant answers, and improves the chances of increasing engagement and conversions. Brands that align their content strategy with AI search capabilities not only improve their search ranking but also become more relevant to users’ needs, driving business growth.
By quickly adjusting your strategies to work with AI, partnering with a
tech agency
that specializes in data analysis and digital marketing can ensure your strategies are both effective and up-to-date. This will give you a competitive edge and open up more opportunities to grow and expand your customer base in today’s digital world.

Behavioral Design: The Tips for Designing Customer Behavior
Did you know? Consumers can be influenced to change their behavior through something as simple as design—no coercion, no explicit guidance, just the creative shaping of an environment that fosters conversions!
Behavioral design is a gr
oundbreaking concept set to revolutionize innovation. It sits at the intersection of psychology, design, and
technology
, transforming how we think about influencing society. Let’s dive deeper into h
ow behavioral design is c
onnected to marketing and how it can drive impactful change.
What is Behavioral Design?
Behavioral design, literally translated as “designing behavior,” closely aligns with its practical application in marketing. It refers to the strategic and effective design of experiences, products, or services aimed at influencing and changing the behavior of target audiences.
This concept integrates knowledge from multiple disciplines—psychology, design, and technology—to create measurable outcomes. Behavioral design is not just about aesthetics; it’s about crafting purposeful environments that guide actions and drive desired results.
The Three Key Components of Behavioral Design
1. Behavioral Psychology
Understanding the decision-making mechanisms of the target audience is fundamental to
Behavioral design
. Marketers need to thoroughly analyze both the motivations driving actions and the barriers preventing behavioral change. By identifying why people do or don’t engage in certain behaviors, marketers can design more precise and effective solutions.
2. Experience Design
Environments and touchpoints have a significant influence on user behavior. Effective design should create experiences with the following characteristics:
Facilitate desired actions.
Simplify usability and reduce complexity.
Provide motivation through appropriate rewards, such as promotions or discounts.
Feature clear and intuitive UI/UX design.
3. Data Analytics
In the era of
digital transformation
, leveraging big data and machine learning is essential for tracking and measuring behavioral changes. These tools enable marketers to analyze and improve customer experiences while predicting future behaviors and market trends. By using data-driven insights, strategies can be refined for maximum impact.
Key Techniques in Behavioral Design
1. Nudge Theory
This theory focuses on subtly “nudging” or stimulating the thoughts, feelings, or actions of the target audience through clever design that guides decision-making without forcing or limiting user choices. For example, placing healthy food prominently in a cafeteria encourages people to choose healthier options simply by increasing their visibility.
2. Gamification
This involves incorporating game mechanics and elements into non-game contexts to foster engagement and motivation. Examples include point systems, unlocking achievements, competing with others, or earning rewards. Gamification is widely used in designing digital products and services because it effectively drives user participation.
3. Choice Architecture
This concept emphasizes designing how options are presented to users, aiming to help them make better decisions. It is based on the understanding that human decision-making is not always rational and is often influenced by the presentation of information and contextual factors. Marketers must carefully consider how to structure and present choices to optimize outcomes.
Pros and Cons of Behavioral Design
Pros of Behavioral Design
Enhances behavioral change:
By leveraging proven psychological principles, Behavioral Design naturally and effectively influences human behavior.
Creates user-centric experiences:
Designing with real user needs and behaviors in mind leads to higher satisfaction and fosters long-term engagement.
Measurable and systematic improvement:
The use of data and in-depth analysis allows for systematic measurement and continuous refinement of outcomes.
Cost-effective in the long run:
Proper design reduces the need for costly corrections, increases user retention, and strengthens brand loyalty, ultimately saving resources over time.
Cons of Behavioral Design
Risk of perceived manipulation:
Some consumers may feel their behavior is being controlled or overly influenced. Transparency in design is essential to mitigate this concern.
Resource and time intensive:
Behavioral design
requires significant investment in research and data analysis during the development phase, though it often proves worthwhile over time.
Uncertain and time-dependent outcomes:
Human behavior is complex and unpredictable, often influenced by uncontrollable external factors. Achieving results throug
h behavioral design requires p
atience and consistent effort.

,

behavioral design in the music streaming industry. The platform uses algorithms to analyze individual user beha
vior, such as which songs are played, skipped, or added to playlists. This data is then processed to create a personalized music experience, encouraging users to continue engaging with the app based on their preferences and listening habits.
Duolingo

s behavioral design to keep users engaged in their lessons like a game. The platform employs a streak system
that motivates learners to return daily to maintain their learning streak. It also breaks lessons into small, manageable units that can be completed quickly, making users feel a sense of progress and accomplishment, which helps sustain their learning habit.
As a new-generation marketer, always remember that we're not just designing products or services; we are designing the experiences and consumer behaviors that drive business results. However, when applying behavioral design to marketing, it is crucial t
o consider ethics, respect privacy, and uphold human rights to demonstrate sincerity towards consumers. This approach is essential for achieving long-term success in the marketing world in a sustainable manner.

What is CriticGPT?
CriticGPT is an AI system developed to inspect and identify potential errors in code, as well as to provide suggestions for improving code quality.
It utilizes Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing technologies to analyze the structure and logic of the code, enabling it to accurately identify issues related to performance, security, and design.

It can also be tailored to align with the specific coding standards of each organization, making CriticGPT an invaluable tool for developing high-quality and reliable software.

Reduces Code Review Time
CriticGPT can analyze a large volume of code in a short amount of time, accurately identifying hidden issues, which significantly saves time on code reviews. Enhances Software Security
CriticGPT helps developers identify potential security vulnerabilities before the software is deployed, reducing the risk of cyber-attacks. It also assists developers in complying with various security standards, such as the OWASP Top 10, ensuring more secure software development.
Improves Performance
With features that offer recommendations on code optimization and the use of appropriate functions, CriticGPT enhances the overall effectiveness of the code. CriticGPT can accurately detect both syntax and logical errors. Upon identifying any mistakes, the system immediately provides suggestions for correction, allowing developers to address and overcome obstacles quickly and efficiently.

Limited Ability to Provide Long Explanations
CriticGPT often gives concise answers, which can make it challenging to fully understand the root causes of problems and how to fix them, especially when dealing with highly complex code.

Concise Responses May Lead to Incomplete Error Identification
As CriticGPT tends to give brief and concise responses, it may sometimes overlook certain types of hidden errors or those related to the surrounding context, leading to incomplete error identification.
Difficulty Analyzing Highly Complex Work
CriticGPT may struggle to analyze very complex code, such as code written in less common programming languages or domain-specific code, which requires specialized knowledge and experience that only human developers possess.
Nonetheless, CriticGPT is a reasonably powerful tool for helping software developers review and improve the quality of code generated by ChatGPT. With its ability to analyze code and provide useful recommendations, CriticGPT serves as a valuable aid that can enhance the efficiency of the software development process to some extent.
It is important to remember that CriticGPT is not a replacement for the expertise of developers but rather a tool to complement and support their work. Therefore, developers should use CriticGPT alongside their own knowledge and experience to create high-quality software that truly meets users' needs.

This system accurately detects the epicenter of earthquakes occurring along the Nankai Trough. Previously, location estimates could deviate by up to 20 kilometers, but the AI has reduced that margin to just a few kilometers—calculating it within only five seconds.
This AI earthquake prediction in Japan uses 3D seismic wave data from high-risk zones to provide real-time analysis. It enables agencies like the Japan Meteorological Agency to issue timely earthquake or tsunami warnings, significantly increasing response speed.
High-precision data in the critical seconds after an earthquake strikes is crucial to minimizing loss of life and property, allowing for faster evacuations and emergency responses.
AI Earthquake Preparedness Models for Soil Stability and Liquefaction Risk
Another significant development is a 3D soil analysis model created by the Shibaura Institute of Technology. This AI earthquake preparedness system uses Artificial Neural Networks and Assembled Learning to evaluate the risk of liquefaction—a phenomenon where the ground turns into liquid due to seismic vibrations. This condition is a major cause of structural collapse in coastal and soft-soil areas.
The model enables:
Urban planners to identify “safe zones” for construction.
Engineers to design structures suited to the soil profile of each area.
Local governments to implement comprehensive disaster risk reduction measures.

What Is a Digital Twin? Understanding Real-Time Simulation

Whether it’s minimizing downtime in manufacturing, understanding consumer behavior in retail, simulating organizational restructuring, or modeling city-wide traffic, energy use, and environmental impact, real-time digital simulation with the digital twin is now central to strategy and decision-making.
What Is Digital Twin?
Digital twin is a cutting‑edge technology that creates a digital replica

customer journey

These real-time digital simulations allow businesses to manage complex systems with accuracy and efficiency, making the digital twin a critical tool for modern organizations.
Benefits of Digital Twin for Business

More Accurate Analysis & Decision-Making

1. Physical Object/System
This is the real-world entity being modeled—machines, vehicles, buildings, infrastructure, or even customer behavior. Data from these objects is continuously streamed to the digital environment.

What is Quantum Computing?
Quantum computing is a computational technolo
gy that uses quantum physics principles to process information, unlike traditional computers that rely on electronic principles. While traditional computers use bits (0 or 1) to process data, quantum computers use qubits, which can exist in states of 0, 1, or both simultaneously.
By leveraging quantum physics, quantum computers can process vast amounts of data at once, making their computing speed significantly faster than traditional computers, especially for solving certain complex problems.
How Does Quantum Computing Work?
Quantum Computing operate based on three key principles:
Superposition
Superposition enables qubits to exist in multiple states simultaneously, unlike traditional computer bits that must be either 0 or 1. This prop
erty allows quantum computing to p
rocess large amounts of information at once, significantly enhancing computational efficiency.
Quantum Entanglement
Quantum entanglement is a phenomenon where two or more qubits become tightly correlated, even across great distances. Changing the state of one entangled qubit immediately affects the
other, enabling quantum computing to transfer a
nd process information more swiftly and efficiently.
Quantum Interference
Quantum Interferen
ce allows quantum computing to se
lect the correct answer from all possible outcomes. This is done by amplifying the probability waves of the correct answers while canceling out those of incorrect answers, leading to accurate and rapid solutions.
The Impact of Quantum Computing on the World in 2025
Quantum computing has the pote
ntial to transform various industries by 2025, including:
Medicine and Pharmaceuticals

drug discovery by simulating molecular reactions with precision, allowing faster testing of drug efficacy. It can also analyze extensive genetic data to develop highly effective personalized medicine.
Finance and Banking
In finance, quantum computing will rev
olutionize risk analysis and portfolio optimization, creating more effective investment strategies. It will also enhance the security of financial transactions through quantum encryption systems that are more secure than current methods.
Transportation and Logistics
Quantum computing will improve com
plex routing problems, enabling the design of time- and energy-efficient transport routes. It will also aid in warehouse management and demand forecasting with high accuracy.
Supply Chain Management
Quantum computing’s ability to process large da
tasets will make supply chain management more efficient, allowing for quick problem prediction and adaptation, reducing costs and enhancing operational flexibility.
Weather Forecasting and Climate Change
Quantum computing will enhance climate simulation accuracy, enabling
earlier natural disaster predictions and effective planning. Additionally, it will aid in studying long-term climate change impacts with great detail.
Automotive Industry
In the automotive sector, quantum computing will help d
evelop more efficient batteries for electric vehicles by simulating complex chemical reactions. It will also support the design of strong, lightweight vehicle structures and advance safe autonomous driving systems.

Challenges and Limitations of Quantum Computing
Qubit Instability
Qubits are highly sensitive to environmental disturbances, such as heat, vibrations, or magnetic fields, which can lead to calculation errors. Developing Quantum Error Correction systems is crucial, and researchers are actively working on this to improve stability.
Requirement for Extremely Low Temperatures
Quantum computers need to operate at extremely low temperatures, near absolute zero (-273.15°C), to maintain the quantum state of qubits. This requirement leads to high operational and maintenance costs.
Continuous Development of New Algorithms and Software
Developing algorithms and software compat
ible with quantum computing is
a significant challenge. The programming and problem-solving approaches for quantum computers are vastly different from traditional computers. Developers need to learn and adapt to new concepts, such as utilizing superposition and entanglement, to solve problems effectively.

With a passion for the science of smell, he founded the company Osmo to develop AI that can create and perceive smells like humans. The ultimate goal is to improve human quality of life and happiness through digital smell technology.
Technology Behind AI That Can Smell
The technology crucial to the functioning of AI odor detection is called the "Principal Odor Map," which uses Machine Learning to analyze the molecular structure of odorous substances. Researchers have collected data on thousands of molecules, along with descriptions of their scent characteristics from experts, to create a large database.
The development of AI that can smell faces several challenges due to the complexity of molecular structures. Even slight changes in structure can significantly alter the smell. Therefore, researchers have to use Deep Learning techniques and Graph Neural Networks to enable AI to deeply understand the relationship between molecular structure and scent characteristics.
Advances in the development of AI odor detection open up opportunities for applications in many areas, from creating new scents for products to early disease diagnosis. Additionally, there are concepts for developing technology that can transmit scents digitally, which could lead to creating more perfect virtual experiences in the future.

Security and Safety Industry
AI that can smell can be used to detect explosives, drugs, or other dangerous substances at airports, checkpoints, or important locations, which will help increase overall social safety.
AI odor detection is an innovation with the potential to transform many industries and improve human quality of life, from helping to diagnose diseases at early stages to developing new products that better meet consumer needs. Although there are still many challenges, with continuous development and cooperation from various sectors, we may see widespread use of AI that can smell in the near future. For example, using smartphone applications to check food quality, using wearable devices to monitor health through sweat odor analysis, or even using smart air conditioning systems that can adjust home scents to suit the mood and needs of residents. This will help elevate the quality of life and create new opportunities in various industries.

7 Proven Storytelling Techniques That Make Brands Memorable
Every time you scroll through social media, you're hit with a rapid flood of content. In today’s hyper-competitive business world, success isn’t just measured by numbers or data—it’s also about how well you communicate your message. That’s where
storytelling

If your brand aims to stand out, mastering and applying business storytelling techniques effectively is a crucial tool. It helps enhance brand perception, boost audience engagement, and drive sustainable business results.
Why Storytelling Is a Must-Have Skill in Today’s World ?
What is storytelling? It’s both a science and an art—not just presenting facts, but crafting emotionally resonant narratives that connect with your audience.
Research from
The New York Times
found that while data-driven content only activates the part of the brain responsible for basic language processing, compelling storytelling techniques trigger multiple regions of the brain, including those linked to sensory experiences. This makes stories far more memorable and engaging than standard communication.
7 Storytelling Techniques Every Brand Should Use
1. Choose the Right Story at the Right Time
Not every campaign needs to tell your brand’s full history. Select a story that aligns with the current context and resonates with your audience. A good story should immediately answer the question, “Why does this matter to me?” and spark emotional responses like empathy, curiosity, or inspiration—leading your audience to take action.
2. Start with a Strong Hook
In an era where users decide within seconds whether to keep watching, a compelling hook is everything. It could be a thought-provoking question, a surprising statistic, or an emotionally charged statement. The goal is to make people want to know what happens next.
3. Structure Your Story with Purpose
Great storytelling needs clear structure. One effective method is the IRS Model, which brings balance and emotional momentum to your narrative:
Intriguing Beginning – Open with something that piques curiosity.
Riveting Middle – Introduce a twist, challenge, or conflict that builds anticipation.
Satisfying Ending – Conclude with a clear takeaway that encourages decision-making.
4. Use Relatable and Universal Plotlines
One of the core principles of effective storytelling techniques is using universally understood plot structures. This makes it easier for your audience to connect with your message and see the human side of your brand. Examples include:
Origin Story – Share how your brand or product began.
Underdog Story – Tell of someone who overcame the odds.
Overcoming the Monster – Highlight challenges your brand or customer conquered.
5. Use Analogies to Explain Complex Ideas
To simplify complex topics, use analogies or metaphors. For instance, explain strategic planning as a chess match, or compare using cloud services to renting an office rather than building one. This not only makes your content easier to understand but also adds creativity to your narrative.
6. View the Story from the Audience’s Perspective
Put yourself in your audience’s shoes. What are their expectations, fears, or pain points? Then design your story to meet them there. When you tailor your narrative to their emotional and informational needs, it becomes the solution they’ve been looking for—not just another message from a brand.
7. Use the Right Tone of Voice
Even the best story can fall flat if delivered in the wrong tone. Match your tone to your brand identity, audience, and platform. For example, a TikTok video may call for a friendly and casual tone, while website content may require a more formal and credible voice.

Campaigns like “Just Do It” and stories of individuals who weren’t born champions but fought their way to success inspire audiences by reinforcing the message: If they can do it, so can I.
It's clear that storytelling is an essential skill for brands of all sizes. Breaking Down MrBeast’s Videos Formula for Viral Content

9 Strategies for Making MrBeast-Style Video Marketing to Maximize Viral Potential
1. A Great Video Isn't Just Visually Appealing — It Must Be Watched Until the End
One of the core principles behind how MrBeast makes videos is maximizing the "Retention Rate," or the percentage of viewers who watch until the end. Attractive visuals and clear audio are not enough; videos must be designed to captivate and sustain audience interest throughout.
A key tip is to identify moments where viewers are likely to drop off and restructure the video to ensure that the beginning and middle sections are the strongest, keeping audiences engaged for as long as possible.
2. Titles and Thumbnails Matter More Than You Think
When it comes to MrBeast videos, the importance of the "Title" and "Thumbnail" cannot be overstated. These elements are the first impressions that determine whether someone clicks or scrolls past.
Effective strategies include crafting emotionally charged, story-driven titles—such as transforming “Trying to Stay in Front of a House for 50 Hours” into “Challenge Accepted! Surviving 50 Hours Outside My House!”—and designing eye-catching thumbnails that accurately reflect the video’s content to maintain credibility.
3. The Golden Minute: Hook Viewers in the First 60 Seconds
According to MrBeast's team, the sharpest drop-off in viewership occurs within the first minute. To succeed, make videos like MrBeast by starting with a bang—whether it's a surprising event, a provocative question, or diving straight into the action within the first 60 seconds. Failing to captivate viewers early drastically reduces overall video performance.
4. Re-Engage Every Three Minutes
Effective video marketing requires building in “Re-Engagement Points” roughly every three minutes. This could include plot twists, unexpected reveals, or humorous moments—techniques frequently seen in MrBeast videos. Regularly rekindling viewer interest is crucial to maintaining attention until the video’s conclusion.
5. Create a Unique "WOW Factor" That Can't Be Imitated
What sets MrBeast videos apart is their unreplicable "WOW Factor"—whether it’s lifting an entire house with a crane or giving away half a million dollars in a simple game.
Brands can adapt this approach by launching unique campaigns that break industry norms, such as unexpected product giveaways or surprising collaborations with influencers.
6. Creativity Beats Expensive Gear
One vital insight from how MrBeast makes videos is that creativity outweighs equipment quality. The MrBeast team focuses on developing fresh ideas rather than relying on professional-grade gear. A compelling story will always outperform the mere use of expensive cameras. In short: don’t let technical limitations hinder creativity.
7. Know Exactly What Moment You’re Filming
Every piece of content produced by MrBeast undergoes meticulous structural planning. Teams know exactly what minute or second of the video they are shooting, allowing them to tailor tone, pacing, and excitement levels to audience expectations. For example:
Minute 1: Peak excitement
Minutes 1–3: Rapid storytelling
Minutes 3–6: Quick scene changes to sustain momentum
Minute 6 onward: Big reveals and an unforgettable finale
8. Never Leave Critical Tasks Unsupervised
One of MrBeast’s golden rules is: Never assume others will handle critical tasks with the same care you would. Whether it’s equipment preparation, shooting logistics, or backup planning, creators must personally oversee all key details to ensure seamless execution. This principle applies to all levels of video marketing—thorough involvement is non-negotiable.
9. Rethink Product Placement: From "Inserting Ads" to "Building Content Together"
Another secret behind the success of MrBeast videos is how seamlessly brands are integrated into the story, rather than feeling like disruptive ads.
Examples include making a brand part of a major prize giveaway or incorporating a sponsor’s product naturally into a challenge. Instead of traditional, overt advertising, the brand becomes an engaging and organic element of the video itself.
While few businesses have resources comparable to MrBeast, understanding viewer behavior and intelligently structuring content can significantly boost performance.
Today’s video marketing landscape isn’t about the most expensive cameras or biggest production budgets—it’s about knowing your audience and telling stories that resonate in the shortest time possible.

What is LIVE Commerce, and Why Is It Gaining Popularity?
LIVE commerce is the process of selling products through LIVE streaming, which allows sellers to engage with customers in real-time.
During a LIVE broadcast, sellers can introduce products, answer customer questions, and interact with the audience, providing detailed product information that makes it easier for consumers to make purchasing decisions. Real-time interaction:

Special discounts or flash sales during LIVE broadcasts encourage customers to buy quickly.

Real-time product reviews:
Customers can witness LIVE demonstrations of products, which helps alleviate concerns about product quality.

Set topics to discuss, such as product launches, reviews, or special promotions. Organize the order of product presentations systematically, which helps keep the LIVE session smooth and engaging for your audience.

For example, show a before image of a common issue, such as acne (Before), and then demonstrate the result after using your product, like clear, glowing skin (After), to help viewers understand the product’s benefits more clearly.

"Did you know that 90% of wrinkles are caused by UV rays?" (Problem)

SEO vs SEM vs SMM: Which Strategy Is Best for Your Business?
Whether you run a small, medium, or large business, everyone is looking for the best strategy to drive growth and increase sales. One of the most common questions in the world of online marketing is,
"Which is more important between SEO, SEM, and SMM (Social Media Marketing)?"
There is no definitive answer to this question because each of these strategies plays a unique role, but they can all work together effectively to enhance each other.
What is SEO? Understanding Search Engine Optimization as an Online Marketing Channel
SEO (Search Engine Optimization) is a strategy aimed at improving a website's ranking in search engine results like Google.
When implementing SEO, marketers consider various factors that affect search rankings, such as choosing the right keywords, optimizing the website structure, and creating high-quality content to signal to search engines that the website is a valuable source of information.

Websites ranking high on Google are often perceived as more trustworthy than competitors.
Low Long-Term Costs:

Limitations of SEO
Time-Consuming:
It takes time and continuous effort to see clear results.
Highly Competitive:
Especially in industries with numerous competitors.
Requires Technical Understanding:
SEO involves restructuring the website and selecting the right keywords.
What is SEM? Understanding Online Advertising Strategies with Search Engine Marketing
SEM (Search Engine Marketing)
is a strategy that uses paid ads through search engines like Google Ads to quickly increase website traffic. With SEM, marketers pay search engines to display their websites in high positions on search results.

Immediate Targeting:
Access your audience immediately after launching ads.
Clear Budget Control:
Marketers can set specific budgets and objectives for their campaigns.
Effective for Short-Term Promotions:
SEM is ideal for promoting products or services when quick results are needed.

High Long-Term Costs:
Continuous spending is required to maintain ad positions in prime spots.
Ongoing Monitoring:
SEM campaigns need frequent adjustments and monitoring to remain effective.
Keyword Bidding Competition:
Popular keywords can lead to higher advertising costs.

Changing platform algorithms may reduce post reach.

Paid ads are often needed to reach a broader audience and increase visibility.
Comparison of SEO, SEM, and SMM: Which Is More Important?
The answer to this question depends on your business goals. If you want to build sustainable traffic and establish long-term credibility, SEO is the best strategy. On the other hand, if your goal is to engage customers rapidly, increase brand awareness, and boost engagement, Social Media Marketing (SMM) will be the most suitable option.
However, online marketing doesn’t have to be limited to just one strategy. Combining SEO, SEM, and SMM can lead to the best results for your business. For example, you could use SEO to attract customers through search results, while using social media to maintain customer relationships or SEM to increase reach in a limited time and immediately capture customer interest.
In conclusion, whether SEO, SEM, or SMM, all these strategies are important. Each has its strengths and limitations, and a well-rounded approach that blends search engine marketing and social media can help your business increase reach, establish credibility, and drive sales effectively. What is Share of Voice? How to Measure Your Brand's Fame
These days, brands that aim to succeed can no longer rely solely on advertising. Building brand awareness and owning media space are key to keeping a brand top of mind for customers. This is why
"Share of Voice (SOV)"
has become a key metric that marketers worldwide prioritize. If your brand is just a small voice drowned out by the larger competitors, it will be hard for customers to remember and choose you over other brands. Many brands, therefore, choose to collaborate with a specialized
digital marketing agency
to strategize and maximize their SOV effectively.
What is Share of Voice (SOV)?
Share of Voice (SOV) refers to the proportion of communication your brand has compared to competitors in the market. It calculates how much your brand is present or communicating with consumers through various channels compared to others in the same industry. This can be measured through several communication channels, such as:
Paid Media:
The percentage of your advertising budget spent on paid media compared to competitors in the same industry. Investment in these media channels reflects your brand's ability to reach consumers through paid platforms.
Owned Media:
The number of website visits or engagement on your brand’s social media, such as likes, shares, or comments on your posts. This engagement helps measure how your brand is interacting with and responding to customers.
Earned Media:
The number of articles, reviews, or mentions of your brand in the media or by consumers without any paid promotion. Mentions in the press or reviews from consumers contribute to building credibility and increasing brand recognition in the market.
SEO (Search Engine Optimization) and Search Visibility:
The share of visibility in search engine results, like Google, when people search for terms related to your brand or product. This measure shows how frequently your brand appears in search results compared to competitors in the same industry.
The Importance of Share of Voice
Measuring Share of Voice (SOV) is not just about gaining an overview of a brand's communication in the market but also holds significance in various aspects that can be applied to improve marketing strategies effectively. These include:
Assessing the Brand's Market Position
Calculating SOV helps a brand understand its position relative to competitors. A high SOV means that your brand has better communication and visibility in the market, which reflects the strength of the brand in terms of marketing and creating awareness among the target audience.
Reflecting Growth Opportunities
Studies have shown that brands with a higher SOV compared to their competitors tend to have greater growth potential in the market. A higher SOV allows brands to increase their market share (Share of Market, or SOM) at a faster rate.
Enabling More Accurate Marketing Strategy Planning
Having clear SOV data allows a brand to plan its marketing strategies more effectively. For instance, analyzing SOV can help a brand decide where to increase its advertising budget or how to adjust its SEO strategy to improve visibility in Google search results. Additionally, it can assist in deciding how to create content or campaigns that generate more engagement from the target audience.
How to Calculate Share of Voice
Share of Voice = (Brand Reach / Total Market Reach) × 100
For example, let’s assume Brand A (your brand) competes with Brands B and C in the same market, and you want to calculate the SOV for Brand A in this market.
Data used for calculation:
Brand A Reach = 50,000 (e.g., website visits, mentions in media and ads)
Brand B Reach = 40,000
Brand C Reach = 30,000
Total Market Reach = Brand A + Brand B + Brand C = 50,000 + 40,000 + 30,000 = 120,000
SOV Calculation:
Share of Voice = (50,000 / 120,000) × 100 = 41.67%
From this calculation, Brand A will have an SOV of 41.67%, meaning your brand has 41.67% of the communication and visibility in the market compared to the two competing brands. This SOV value helps you assess your brand’s position in the market and refine your marketing strategy accordingly.
﻿
How to Increase Share of Voice to Enhance Brand Recognition
Maximize advertising budget
Investing in advertising plays a crucial role in increasing SOV. Strategies like Programmatic Advertising or Targeted Ads help enhance efficiency by reaching specific target groups, reducing advertising costs, and maximizing results. This approach ensures that the brand appears in the right places and attracts more attention.
Create high-quality content that appeals to the target audience
Developing high-quality content that resonates with the target audience can significantly boost engagement and brand mentions. For example, creating engaging video content or utilizing influencer marketing to promote the brand can create a larger impact.
Leverage social media
Social media is a powerful tool for increasing SOV. Posting content that aligns with consumer interests, responding to inquiries, and interacting with followers help increase engagement and strengthen the connection between the brand and its audience.
Improve website ranking in search results using effective SEO techniques

What Are the Sales Channels? Discover 3 Platforms for Brands
Selling products online is now a crucial strategy for businesses looking to expand their market and reach customers more effectively. If you're wondering what are the sales channels available today, the three main platforms—
Marketplaces, Brand.com sites, and Social Commerce
—are gaining immense popularity among SMEs and retailers.
However, selecting the right platform significantly impacts your sales performance and business growth. Let’s dive into the advantages and limitations of each channel, and explore some helpful tips to decide where to sell products most effectively.
Marketplace: A Sales Channel with a Large Customer Base
Advantages of Selling Through a Marketplace
Access to a Large Customer Base Quickly
Marketplaces offer a vast and geographically diverse customer base, enabling businesses to reach potential buyers faster. Selling on these platforms can drastically cut down the time needed to build a new customer base. Marketplaces also provide built-in support systems like online payments, shipping logistics, and customer service.
Ready-to-Use Infrastructure
With ready-made systems for payments, shipping, and after-sales service, sellers don't need to invest in technology development or backend management. This allows businesses to start selling immediately.
Consumer Trust Through Reviews and Product Guarantees
Buyers often trust marketplaces that offer customer reviews and product guarantees. This credibility can help boost trust in your brand and drive sales.
Promotions and Campaigns to Attract Shoppers
Frequent sales campaigns like flash sales and discount coupons make it easier for businesses to boost sales without creating promotions from scratch.
Limitations of Selling Through a Marketplace
High Competition
Because many sellers don't fully understand what are the distribution channels available and immediately turn to marketplaces, competition is fierce—especially on price. Businesses often need to offer discounts or incentives, which can reduce profit margins.
Sales and Advertising Fees
Marketplaces typically charge commission fees on each sale and additional fees for advertising, which can eat into your profits.
Limited Control Over the Customer Experience and Branding
Selling through a marketplace limits your ability to control the customer journey or build a distinctive brand identity, as most of the experience is dictated by the platform’s structure.
Brand.com: Your Own Branded Online Store
Advantages of Selling Through Brand.com
Full Ownership of Your Brand
Running your own website gives you complete control over design, product presentation, and the customer experience.
Customer Data Collection for CRM
Selling via Brand.com allows businesses to collect valuable customer data and use it to develop effective Customer Relationship Management (CRM) strategies, fostering long-term loyalty.
No Platform Commission Fees
By selling directly through your own website, you avoid platform fees and can maximize your profit margins.
Enhanced Credibility and Brand Image
Having your own well-designed website strengthens your brand’s credibility and supports long-term business growth.
Limitations of Selling Through Brand.com
Initial Investment in Website Development
Building a professional website requires investment in design, payment processing systems, stock management, and backend operations.
Marketing Efforts Needed to Drive Traffic
Unlike marketplaces that naturally attract visitors, Brand.com sites require strong marketing strategies to bring in customers.
More Complex Operations
Managing your own e-commerce site means handling payments, logistics, and customer service on your own, making operations more complex compared to marketplaces.
Social Commerce: Direct Sales Channels to Engage Customers
Advantages of Selling Through Social Commerce
Direct Communication and Interaction With Customers
Social Commerce platforms like Facebook, Instagram, LINE OA, and TikTok allow businesses to engage directly with customers, building stronger relationships and trust.
Full Control Over Brand and Sales Strategy
Social Commerce empowers businesses to manage all aspects of product presentation, content creation, and promotions, making it easier to fine-tune strategies based on target audiences.
Lower Costs Compared to Marketplaces
Social Commerce platforms generally have lower fees, allowing sellers to leverage organic reach and minimize advertising costs.
Higher Conversion Through Live and Chat Commerce
Live streaming and chat interactions enhance the buying experience, offering personalized and immediate responses that boost conversion rates.
Limitations of Selling Through Social Commerce
Self-Management of All Processes
Sellers are responsible for managing payments, shipping, and customer service independently.
Constant Algorithm Changes
Social media algorithms change frequently, potentially reducing customer reach without additional advertising investment.
No Automated Stock Management
Unlike marketplaces, inventory must be manually updated, requiring accuracy and attention to detail.
Unsure Where to Sell Products? Social Commerce Might Be Your Best Bet
While marketplaces offer a large, ready-made customer base and robust support systems, Social Commerce is rapidly emerging as an attractive option—especially in countries like Thailand, where consumers spend a lot of time on social media.
Strategies for Successful Social Commerce Selling
Create Engaging Content
High-quality content like product review videos, live streams, and influencer collaborations can significantly boost visibility and customer interest.
Use Chat Commerce for Real-Time Customer Support
Answering customer inquiries through chat builds confidence and makes it easier for customers to make a purchase decision.
Targeted Ads on Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok
Advertising should be carefully targeted to your ideal customer groups to maximize reach and conversion rates.
Use Management Tools to Boost Efficiency
Supporting tools like LINE OA, chatbots, and CRM systems help streamline sales management and enhance customer service.
Now that you understand what are the sales channels, it’s clear that selecting the right online sales platform depends on your business’s objectives and resources.
Marketplace is ideal for businesses aiming to access a broad customer base quickly, supported by ready-to-use systems.
Brand.com is perfect for businesses wanting full control, enhanced credibility, and stronger branding over the long term.
Social Commerce is one of the best channels to sell products for businesses that want to control their brand narrative, build direct customer relationships, and minimize platform fees.
For businesses aiming for sustainable growth, Social Commerce is a highly potential option. Implementing the right strategies can help businesses build a stable customer base and achieve long-term sales growth. Additionally, utilizing

The Electronic Government Act: The Starting Point of Change
The Electronic Government Act is a key driver pushing all government agencies to seriously upgrade their work processes to digital standards. This includes document handling, service delivery, internal coordination, and communication with citizens. The act targets four main objectives: convenience, speed, transparency, and service efficiency.
However, this transition has not been smooth due to the government’s long-standing reliance on paper-based systems. The challenge lies in restructuring organizations, workflows, and internal culture to effectively embrace new technologies—requiring careful planning and continuous development.
What Are the 6 Components of Government Work in the Digital Transformation Era?
To ensure an efficient transition to digital systems, six key components must work in harmony:
1. Establishing a Strong Data Governance Foundation
Systematic data management is the heart of modern government operations. Agencies must define clear guidelines for data storage, usage, sharing, and security standards across the organization to build trust and ensure data accuracy.
2. Full Digitization of Work Processes
Converting documents from paper to digital format is just the first step. More importantly, workflows must be fully adapted to digital systems—from submitting applications electronically to real-time approval and tracking.
3. Integration of Data Across Agencies
A major problem in public service is siloed operations. Connecting data between agencies is key to reducing redundancies, improving efficiency, and delivering seamless services to citizens.
4. One-Stop Service
Consolidating services from multiple agencies into a single access point makes it easier for citizens to reach services, both online and offline. This elevates the public service experience to meet the expectations of the digital age.
5. Open Government Data for Transparency
Making government data publicly available in accessible, usable formats increases operational transparency, builds citizen trust, and can spur innovation—especially for SMEs seeking deep insights to develop their businesses.
6. Developing Digital Skills for Government Personnel
Sustainable digital transformation is impossible without a digitally skilled workforce. Government agencies must invest in training, skill development, and mindset shifts so officials can use technology flexibly and confidently.
Challenges for Government Organizations in Adopting Digital Transformation
Transitioning fully to digital government operations offers opportunities to improve service quality and reduce long-term costs in time and resources. However, significant challenges remain, such as:
Data Security and Cybersecurity
In an era where data is a critical asset, investing in cybersecurity is essential to protect citizens’ personal information and build trust in government electronic systems.
Organizational and Personnel Adaptation
Many agencies remain tied to traditional workflows. Successful digital transformation requires open-minded leadership that promotes change and fosters a culture that embraces learning and adaptation.
Investment in Technology and Infrastructure
Digital transformation demands appropriate investment. Governments must allocate budgets to develop digital infrastructure and select technologies that meet long-term operational needs.

How to Create a Loyalty Program to Build Repeat Customers
One of the most powerful strategies to encourage repeat business is a loyalty program — a system that rewards customers and builds long-term relationships. A loyalty program offers incentives and special privileges to promote repeat purchases. However, knowing how to create a loyalty program that succeeds goes beyond offering simple rewards. It requires thoughtful design that considers customer behavior, motivation, and ease of use, creating memorable experiences that drive true brand loyalty over time.
What Is a Loyalty Program and Why Is It Important?
A loyalty program is a marketing strategy designed to reward customers for their repeat purchases.
The main goal is to retain existing customers, increase purchase frequency, and maximize customer lifetime value (CLV). In addition to boosting sales, loyalty programs help strengthen the relationship between customers and brands, fostering deeper emotional connections that encourage long-term loyalty.
Benefits of a Loyalty Program for Businesses
Increases Repeat Purchases
A well-designed loyalty program incentivizes customers to return by offering valuable rewards such as points that can be redeemed for discounts, gifts, or exclusive deals.
Strengthens Long-Term Relationships
Point-based systems make customers feel like valued "members" of the brand community, deepening their emotional connection and increasing the likelihood of ongoing support.
Creates Competitive Differentiation
In crowded markets, a standout loyalty program can give a brand a competitive edge by delivering superior value and memorable experiences.
Encourages Word-of-Mouth Referrals
Satisfied customers who enjoy collecting points and receiving rewards are more likely to recommend the brand to others, either through personal referrals or social media, naturally boosting brand awareness.
Popular Types of Loyalty Programs
1. Point-Based Loyalty Program
Customers earn points with every purchase or designated action, which can later be redeemed for rewards such as discounts, gifts, or special privileges.
2. Tiered Loyalty Program
This system categorizes customers into tiers based on cumulative spending (e.g., Silver, Gold, Platinum). Higher-tier members receive greater benefits, motivating customers to climb the loyalty ladder.
3. Cashback Loyalty Program
Customers receive a percentage of their spending back as credit or cash, offering a tangible incentive to keep making purchases.
4. Subscription-Based Loyalty Program
Customers pay a monthly or annual subscription fee to access special benefits like permanent discounts, early product access, or exclusive services.
5. Gamification Loyalty Program
Integrating game mechanics like unlocking levels, collecting coins, or completing challenges makes earning rewards more engaging and interactive, increasing customer participation.
How to Create a Loyalty Program That Succeeds
1. Align the Program with Business Strategy
The goals of the loyalty program must be clearly defined, such as increasing repeat purchases within three months or raising the average basket size per transaction.
2. Offer Meaningful Rewards
Rewards should provide either high emotional or economic value, such as exclusive gifts, member-only discounts, or access to VIP events not available to the general public.
3. Ensure Ease of Use
Registration, point collection, and reward redemption should be simple and streamlined, preferably accessible through online platforms like apps, websites, or digital membership cards.
4. Communicate Effectively and Consistently
Regularly update customers about their point balance, new rewards, or special promotions via multiple channels, including email, SMS, or social media, to maintain engagement.
5. Use Customer Behavior Data for Optimization
Analyzing customer spending patterns, interests, and behaviors allows businesses to personalize the loyalty program, offering rewards that align closely with individual preferences.
Examples of Successful Loyalty Programs
Starbucks Rewards
Starbucks’ rewards program allows customers to collect stars and redeem them for free drinks and special treats. Members also enjoy exclusive perks like mobile order-ahead and a free birthday beverage.
Sephora Beauty Insider
Sephora’s tiered membership system offers different rewards based on spending levels, including exclusive promotions and gifts for top-tier members.
The 1 Card (Central Group)
One of Thailand’s most comprehensive loyalty programs, The 1 Card allows customers to collect and redeem points across a wide range of Central Group brands, offering both flexibility and convenience.
A loyalty program is a highly effective marketing tool for building long-term customer relationships and increasing repeat business. To maximize impact, businesses should select the type of loyalty system that best fits their target audience, design an easy-to-use platform, and offer attractive rewards that truly motivate customers to stay engaged. Consistently tracking and analyzing customer behavior will help further refine and optimize the program, contributing to sustainable business growth over time.

Entrepreneurs across industries are increasingly aware that the super app trend is gaining momentum, particularly in Asian markets where platforms like WeChat, Grab, and LINE have become essential to consumers' daily lives. At the same time, many businesses still rely on conventional apps to deliver specific, targeted services. This raises a critical question: Should businesses use a super app or a traditional app to drive success?
What is a Super App and Why Should Large Enterprises Pay Attention?
A super app is a platform that integrates a wide variety of services into a single application. Users can access different functions—such as messaging, payment, food delivery, and transportation—without switching between apps.
One of clear examples of super apps is WeChat in Asia, which started as a simple chat app and evolved into a comprehensive ecosystem.
Key advantages of super apps for large enterprises include:
Multi-channel customer engagement
through a single app, enhancing accessibility and providing a seamless user experience.
Support for multiple services within a unified system
, reducing fragmentation and simplifying internal operations.
Complete ecosystem development
, enabling better CRM, personalization, and data analytics to deepen customer insights.

How a Super App Enhances Organizational Operations
Consolidates Key Services Into a Single Platform
One major benefit of having a super app is the ability to integrate essential organizational services into one platform, such as:
Human Resource Management (HRM)
Customer Relationship Management (CRM)
E-commerce platforms for product and service sales
Loyalty programs to foster and maintain customer loyalty
By consolidating these systems, businesses can reduce operational complexity, improve workflow efficiency, and provide both employees and customers faster access to necessary services—all while building a strong foundation for future service expansion without starting from scratch.
Enables Efficient Management of Large-Scale Customer Data
Utilizing a super app allows organizations to manage customer data in a structured, secure, and centralized manner. With all data housed in a centralized system, businesses can perform highly effective data analysis.
These deeper insights enable precise personalization strategies, such as:
Recommending customized products and services
Offering targeted promotions
Designing unique customer experiences
This strengthens long-term customer relationships and maximizes profitability opportunities.
Reduces Dependence on External Systems
Investing in a super app empowers organizations to control their infrastructure and data without relying heavily on third-party solutions. Having full ownership over the system enhances an enterprise’s ability to execute full-scale digital transformation.
Businesses can develop, adjust, or improve services based on strategic plans without waiting for external providers’ approvals or facing their limitations.
Additionally, reduced reliance on outside systems enhances data security and minimizes operational risks tied to external service providers.
Accelerates Innovation and New Feature Deployment
A super app enables organizations to test and launch new features more quickly due to the platform's flexible architecture. New services—such as online booking tools, innovative payment methods, or exclusive membership systems—can be introduced without disrupting the core platform.
Moreover, with a shared user base within a single platform, gathering feedback and analyzing real-time usage becomes easier, allowing businesses to continuously innovate and respond to market demands quickly.
Enhances Omnichannel Capabilities
Super apps are specifically designed to support true omnichannel experiences, seamlessly connecting services across apps, websites, offline branches, and various social media platforms.
Smooth data integration across channels allows customers to start a transaction in one channel and complete it in another without disruption. Organizations can thus deliver consistent, personalized customer experiences—critical for building a competitive advantage in today's market.
Case Study: Examples of Super Apps That Found Success in Asia
WeChat
WeChat stands as one of the most successful examples of a super app worldwide. It started in 2011 as a basic chat application and quickly expanded to cover nearly every aspect of daily life for users in China.
Today, WeChat is not just a communication tool but a lifestyle hub offering:
Messaging, voice calls, and video calls
Money transfers and payments via WeChat Pay
Food ordering, ride-hailing, and online shopping
Access to government services such as hospital appointment booking, license renewals, and official document submissions
WeChat’s strength lies in seamlessly integrating various services into a single platform, creating a massive ecosystem where users rarely need to exit the app. This integration has made WeChat a driving force in China's digital economy.
Grab
Grab initially launched in Malaysia in 2012 as a ride-hailing app but quickly expanded throughout Southeast Asia, evolving into a super app that meets the needs of modern urban living.
Grab's current services include:
Car and motorcycle ride-hailing
Food delivery (GrabFood) and package delivery (GrabExpress)
Payment systems and e-wallets (GrabPay)
Financial services, including microloans, insurance, and investment options (Grab Financial Group)
Grab has successfully created a cohesive ecosystem that encourages cross-service usage, increasing revenue streams from its existing user base and serving as a leading example of a super app driving digital innovation in the region.
LINE
LINE began as a popular chat application in Japan before expanding its capabilities to become a super app that integrates a wide range of services, including communication, finance, and marketing. Today, key services within the LINE platform include:
Chat, voice calls, and video calls
Money transfers and payments via LINE Pay
Additional financial services such as LINE BK (online banking) and LINE MAN (food delivery and lifestyle services in Thailand)
LINE Official Account for businesses to create marketing channels and CRM with customers
LINE Shopping and LINE Ads Platform, which help expand business opportunities for all types of entrepreneurs
LINE's success reflects the power of deeply understanding user behavior in each country and developing a platform that caters to both personal and business needs simultaneously.
For businesses seeking flexibility, customer base expansion, and reduced development costs, building a super app is an ideal solution—especially for enterprises aiming to reach a wide range of consumers and build an ecosystem that supports long-term growth.
